tests.standards:
Testing Stack: Vitest 4.0.3 + React Testing Library 16.3.0 + user-event 14.6.1 + jest-axe 10.0.0 for accessibility auditing.
Test Organization: Each primitive component requires comprehensive test suite with 15+ tests covering: (1) Rendering - all variant and size combinations render correctly, custom className support, default props validation; (2) Interaction - click handlers, keyboard navigation (Enter/Space for buttons, Arrow keys for Select), disabled state prevents interaction; (3) Accessibility - ARIA attributes present (roles, labels, states), focus management with visual indicators (focus:ring-2), axe accessibility audit passes with zero violations, keyboard-only navigation works; (4) Props and Types - TypeScript prop validation, ref forwarding works, additional HTML attributes supported; (5) Edge Cases - invalid inputs handled gracefully (ProgressBar: negative values, >100%, NaN), empty states (Select with no options), boundary conditions.
Animation Testing: Mock Framer Motion in tests (vi.mock('framer-motion')) to avoid animation complexity. Test animation variants exist (hidden/visible/hover/tap) but don't test actual animation frames. Verify spring physics parameters (stiffness, damping) are defined.
Coverage Target: Minimum 15+ tests per component (45+ total for Badge, ProgressBar, Select). Actual standard from Epic 5 is 20+ tests per component (Button has 284 lines of tests, FAB has 21 tests). Aim for comprehensive coverage, not just meeting minimum.
Test Execution: Run with 'npm test' (watch mode) or 'npm run test:run' (single run). Use 'npm run test:coverage' to verify coverage metrics. All tests must pass before deployment.

test-idea.tests: - Render with default props - Render all 5+ variants (success, warning, error, info, primary) - Render all 3 sizes (sm, md, lg) - Apply variant color classes correctly (bg-green for success, bg-yellow for warning, bg-red for error, bg-blue for info) - Apply size classes correctly (text-xs/sm/base, px-2/3/4) - Support custom className merged with defaults - Render children content correctly (text, numbers, icons)
- Use semantic HTML (span element, not div) - Support aria-label for screen readers - Pass axe accessibility audit (zero violations) - Sufficient color contrast for all variants (WCAG AA)
- TypeScript interface enforces valid variant values - Default to primary variant if not specified - Default to md size if not specified - Support additional HTML span attributes

- Render with value 0%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100% - Render all 4 color variants (primary, success, warning, error) - Render all 3 sizes (sm, md, lg) - Show label when showLabel=true - Hide label when showLabel=false - Apply custom className
- Use Framer Motion for progress bar fill animation - Smooth transition when value changes (mock motion.div) - Spring physics parameters defined (stiffness, damping)
- Use role="progressbar" - Set aria-valuenow to current value - Set aria-valuemin="0" - Set aria-valuemax="100" - Support custom aria-label - Pass axe accessibility audit
- Handle negative values (clamp to 0) - Handle values >100 (clamp to 100) - Handle NaN or undefined values (default to 0) - Handle decimal values (e.g., 42.7%)
- Render with options array - Show placeholder when no value selected - Show selected option value - Render disabled state - Render individual disabled options - Apply custom className
- Click to open dropdown - Click option to select it - Call onChange with selected value - Click outside to close dropdown - Disabled select prevents opening - Disabled option cannot be selected

- Enter/Space opens dropdown - ArrowDown moves to next option - ArrowUp moves to previous option - Home jumps to first option - End jumps to last option - Enter selects focused option and closes dropdown - Escape closes dropdown without selecting - Tab closes dropdown and moves focus away - Keyboard navigation skips disabled options

- Use role="listbox" for dropdown - Use role="option" for each option - Set aria-selected on selected option - Use aria-activedescendant for keyboard focus - Support custom aria-label - Focus trap when dropdown open - Visual focus indicator on focused option - Pass axe accessibility audit
- Type to filter options when searchable=true - Highlight matching text - Show "No results" when filter returns empty
- Handle empty options array - Handle single option (no arrow navigation needed) - Handle very long option lists (100+ options) - Handle options with duplicate values

- All variants visible in Storybook - Interactive controls work (change variant, size, value) - Accessibility addon shows zero violations - Examples show real use cases (workout completion, status indicators, exercise filters)

- Build logs show zero errors - Fonts (Cinzel, Lato) load correctly in production - Glass morphism effects render (backdrop-blur visible) - Sheet components functional (BottomSheet/Drawer) - FAB component renders with correct animation - New primitives (Badge, ProgressBar, Select) render in production
